rules.text: No discrimination. Our community promotes a safe and healthy environment for everyone, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.
Do not share explicit materials (videos, pictures, articles, etc.) or discuss sexual acts, excessive violence, or gore.
Be kind and respectful. Treat others as you would like to be treated
No doxxing. Please do not share another person’s information or sensitive materials without their consent.
No trolling. Trolling is someone who intentionally instigates conflict, hostility, or arguments online. Don’t be a troll.
No spamming. Please do not repeatedly post the same message or spam others (i.e. tagging someone repeatedly).
Do not post or engage in any illegal behavior.
No spoilers. If you want to discuss anything of that sort, please use the spoiler (Content Warning) tag.

records.text: This weekend, I finished second book of The Dandelion Dynasty series. The main story starts here. Fewer characters to focus on and the story took an interesting shape. A lot of twists and turns to keep you on the edge. Plenty of engineering marvels. Diverse women characters, yeah! Strong Chinese influence where philosophy and poetry weaved into the story. Also into the concept of spoken and written language.Onto the next book!#AmReading #RoseReads

records.text: Finished A Darker Shade of Magic by V.E. Schwab. It's the first book of a trilogy, but the ending is not much of a cliffhanger. I think the concept of having parallel cities of an existing place is nice. It has the advantage of familiarity for worldbuilding but still give some room for imagination. The magic system is quite vague but interesting. A bit turned off by the "not like other girls" character and possible love triangle though.#AmReading #RoseReads

records.text: Finished Klara And The Sun quite a while ago. This is my 3rd Ishiguro Novel and I like it. Its story reminded me to Never Let Me Go. Both of the narrators were spending significant time in isolation and under surveillance, influencing their perception of the world. I love Ishiguro's description of the environment in his books. I felt like transported in idyllic countryside. While most of the story was interesting and intriguing, the ending felt anticlimactic.#AmReading #RoseReads

Also into the concept of spoken and written language.Onto the next book!#AmReading #RoseReads

records.text: Finished A Darker Shade of Magic by V.E. Schwab. It's the first book of a trilogy, but the ending is not much of a cliffhanger. I think the concept of having parallel cities of an existing place is nice. It has the advantage of familiarity for worldbuilding but still give some room for imagination. The magic system is quite vague but interesting. A bit turned off by the "not like other girls" character and possible love triangle though.#AmReading #RoseReads

records.text: Finished Klara And The Sun quite a while ago. This is my 3rd Ishiguro Novel and I like it. Its story reminded me to Never Let Me Go. Both of the narrators were spending significant time in isolation and under surveillance, influencing their perception of the world. I love Ishiguro's description of the environment in his books. I felt like transported in idyllic countryside. While most of the story was interesting and intriguing, the ending felt anticlimactic.#AmReading #RoseReads

records.text: This weekend, I finished second book of The Dandelion Dynasty series. The main story starts here. Fewer characters to focus on and the story took an interesting shape. A lot of twists and turns to keep you on the edge. Plenty of engineering marvels. Diverse women characters, yeah! Strong Chinese influence where philosophy and poetry weaved into the story. Also into the concept of spoken and written language.Onto the next book!#AmReading #RoseReads

records.text: Finished A Darker Shade of Magic by V.E. Schwab. It's the first book of a trilogy, but the ending is not much of a cliffhanger. I think the concept of having parallel cities of an existing place is nice. It has the advantage of familiarity for worldbuilding but still give some room for imagination. The magic system is quite vague but interesting. A bit turned off by the "not like other girls" character and possible love triangle though.#AmReading #RoseReads

records.text: Finished Klara And The Sun quite a while ago. This is my 3rd Ishiguro Novel and I like it. Its story reminded me to Never Let Me Go. Both of the narrators were spending significant time in isolation and under surveillance, influencing their perception of the world. I love Ishiguro's description of the environment in his books. I felt like transported in idyllic countryside. While most of the story was interesting and intriguing, the ending felt anticlimactic.#AmReading #RoseReads
